ã€

#â€‹709 â€” October 17, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Story of Web Framework Hono, By Its Creator â€” Hono is a neat, lightweight framework designed to run on any JavaScript runtime that has been picking up steam in the past year. You can create a simple app reminiscent of Express.js, say, but run it on Cloudflare Workers, Deno, Bun, or Node. Itâ€™s in heavy use all over the place, and has lots of interesting features like letting you write HTML withÂ JSX.

Yusuke Wada

Supercharge Your Node.js Code Reviews with AI â€” Tired of event loop bottlenecks, async errors, and dependency vulnerabilities slipping through code reviews? CodeRabbit, an AI-powered code review tool, analyzes your codebase line-by-line, detecting perf issues, optimizing async patterns, and enhancing security with each pullÂ request.

CodeRabbit sponsor

Node v23.0.0 (Current) Released â€” Say hello to the newest release line of Node.js that gets all the cutting edge features first (Node 22 will soon become an LTS release as per the usual schedule). Node v23 notably enables support for loading ES modules with require() by default, drops 32-bit Windows support, and node --run goesÂ stable.

Rafael Gonzaga

JS0/JSSugar: 'The Tooling Will Continue Until Morale Improves' â€” In a rather quirky slidedeck presented at TC39 recently, an idea was floated to call the language JS engines implement â€˜JS0â€™ and a myriad of features that have to be compiled to JS0 â€˜JSSugarâ€™. It might not surprise you that this idea is considered.. controversial and â–¶ï¸ Theo Browne did a 25-minute video digging into itÂ further.

Caolan

IN BRIEF:

  • Greensock's popular JavaScript animation library GSAP has been acquired by Webflow â€“ it'll continue to be updated and maintained as before.

  • Did you know setTimeout struggles to set timeouts longer than 25 days (or 2^31 milliseconds) in duration? Never fear: Evan Hahn unveils setBigTimeout.

  • quickjs-cross-compiler provides a way to generate static binaries of JavaScript apps for x86_64, i686, ARM 7, andÂ ARM64.

RELEASES:

  • Electron 33 â€“ The popular way to build cross-platform desktop apps gets a bump up to Chromium 30, Node 20.18, V8 13, but drops macOS 10.15Â support.

  • Wasp 0.15 â€“ Wasp is a Rails-like framework using Node, React &Â Prisma.

  • Zustand 5.0 â€“ Simple, flux-inspired state management forÂ React.

  • Javet 4.0 â€“ Java + V8. Embed Node.js and V8 intoÂ Java.

  • Next.js 15 Release Candidate 2, Node.js 22.10.0 (Current), Jasmine 5.4

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

How to Build an Image Search App with CLIP, Postgres & JavaScript â€” A tutorial that brings together a lot of ideas in one place. CLIP is used to turn images into text descriptions. Postgres is used as a vector database. JavaScript provides the glue for both the frontend (with React) and backend (Node.js).

Haziqa Sajid

Using Sibling Parameters as Default Values in Functions â€” function myFunc(arg1, arg2 = arg1)? A technique safely in the â€˜not a lot of people know you can do thatâ€™ pile. Alex digs into it a bit and looks at some useÂ cases.

Alex MacArthur

[Guide] Debugging Microservices & Distributed Systems â€” Learn best practices on understanding and debugging modern web applications. Read theÂ guide.

Sentry sponsor

Liskov's Gun: The Parallel Evolution of React and Web Components â€” An opinion piece so long thereâ€™s an EPUB version. Baldur tackles Web Components, their growing pains, why frameworks like React took a different path, and why the whole topic remains a difficult circle toÂ square.

Baldur Bjarnason

React Folder Structure in Five Steps, 2024 Edition â€” Articles about structuring React apps are always popular; this one breaks the idea down to five steps from the simplest of apps to more complex ones. Bulletproof React is worth a look too for somethingÂ broader.

Robin Wieruch

Optimize Your Builds with Depotâ€™s GitHub Actions Price Calculator â€” Depot just launched a GitHub Actions price calculator. Get a cost breakdown and make your builds faster andÂ cheaper!

Depot / GitHub Actions Price Calculator sponsor

ğŸ“„ ğŸ«£ Implementing Regular Expressions in TypeScript Types (Badly) â€“ Itâ€™s almost Halloween so scary stories areÂ welcome. Steven Kalt

ğŸ“„ 'I Interviewed 100 DevTools Founders and This Is What I Learned' Jack Bridger

ğŸ“„ Handling In-Browser Paste Events in JavaScript Raymond Camden

ğŸ“„ The Nuances of Base64 Encoding Strings in JavaScript Matt Joseph

ğŸ“„ How to Convert CommonJS to ESM Andy Jiang

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ApexCharts: Flexible Interactive Charting Library â€” A mature and frequently updated charting library for creating interactive data visualizations, with sparklines, heatmaps, line charts, funnel charts, pies, and others. Can be used in a vanilla way or alongside Angular, Vue or React and there are lots of live examples (with code for each). GitHubÂ repo.

ApexCharts

Over 100 Algorithms and Data Structures Demonstrated in JS â€” Examples of numerous common algorithms (e.g. bit manipulation, Pascalâ€™s triangle, Hamming distance) and data structures (e.g. linked lists, tries, graphs) withÂ explanations.

Oleksii Trekhleb et al.

Developer Kit: Learn How to Troubleshoot Front-End Issues Faster â€” Get the kit curated to help front-end developers better understand user activity and resolve issues moreÂ efficiently.

Datadog sponsor

fast-grid: The World's Most Performant DOM-Based Web Table? â€” A bold claim, but you can see for yourself using the online demo, which lets you filter, sort, and scroll simultaneously for a trueÂ test.

Gabriel Petersson

ğŸ¨Â Color Thief: Grab Color Palettes from Images â€” Given an image, this uses canvas to return a list of the dominant colors. Works in browsers orÂ Node.

Lokesh Dhakar

Node Version Manager Desktop 4.0 â€” A Tauri-powered desktop app for macOS, Windows and Linux to manage multiple installed versions of Node on yourÂ system.

rainbow

ğŸ¹Â ChordSymbol: Chord Symbol Parser and Renderer â€” Accepts chord names in strings (e.g. G7/B, Cadd9, Asus2) and lets you access the notes those chords are made of. GitHubÂ repo.

Christophe NoÃ«l

  • debounce 2.2 â€“ Delay function calls until a set time elapses after the lastÂ invocation.

  • ğŸ˜³ NSFW.js 4.2 â€“ Client-side NSFW image detection viaÂ TensorFlow.js.

  • Secretlint 9.0 â€“ Tool to prevent committingÂ credentials/secrets.

  • â˜ï¸ vue-tel-input 9.2 â€“ Telephone number input for Vue.Â (Demo.)

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ Qalendar 3.9 â€“ Event calendar and date picker for Vue 3.

  • Vaul 1.1 â€“ Unstyled drawer ReactÂ component.Â (Demo.)

  • Mineflayer 4.22 â€“ Create Minecraft bots inÂ JavaScript.

  • FxTS 1.1 â€“ Functional programming library forÂ TS/JS.

ğŸª Hookdeck: A serverless queue to reliably send, receive, transform, filter, and route events across your event-drivenÂ apps.

#â€‹710 â€” October 24, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Svelte 5 is Alive â€” The long awaited next major release of Svelte, the compiler-driven JS UI framework, is the â€œmost significant release in the projectâ€™s historyâ€, while remaining largely backwards compatible. A big addition is runes for explicitly declaring reactive state, but thereâ€™s much more besides. The official svelte.dev site has also undergone a big rebuild to act as an â€˜omnisiteâ€™ for all thingsÂ Svelte.

The Svelte Team

ğŸ“º If you want to see how to use Svelte 5, Syntax's Scott Tolinski has released â–¶ï¸Â aÂ 2Â hour Svelte 5 basics course onÂ YouTube.

FlexGrid by Wijmo: The Industry-Leading JavaScript Datagrid â€” A fast and flexible DataGrid for building modern web apps. Key features and virtualized rendering are included in the grid module. Pick and choose special features to keep your app small. Built for JavaScript, extended to Angular, React, andÂ Vue.

Wijmo From MESCIUS inc sponsor

GenAIScript: Microsoft's Generative AI Scripting Environment â€” Microsoft is really poking at AI from all angles. TypeChat introduced a type-safe way to talk to LLMs; now GenAIScript offers a JavaScript-powered way to programmatically assemble prompts and process responses. They claim it â€œbrings essential LLM prompt tooling into a cohesive scriptingÂ environment.â€

Microsoft

Next.js 15 Released â€” Itâ€™s a big week for the popular (some may even argue default) React framework with Next.js Conf starting today, as well as this release. It includes a codemod CLI for easier upgrading, async request APIs, alignment with React 19, andÂ more.

Vercel

IN BRIEF:

  • Developer IDE firm JetBrains has announced its WebStorm JavaScript/TypeScript IDE is now free for non-commercial use which, notably, also covers paid contentÂ creators.

  • The popular shadcn/ui component library has unveiled a new suite of components for building sidebars.

  • âŒš Spectra is a hackable smartwatch seeking funding on Kickstarter (but it has passed its initial goal). ESP32-S3 based, it appears able to run JavaScript as shown in the 'dev experience'Â screenshots.

  • ğŸ™‹ This year's State of React survey is now open to take until NovemberÂ 19.

RELEASES:

  • âš›ï¸ React Native 0.76 â€“ A big release. The so-called 'New Architecture' is now used by default (so you can now use all the modern React features in RN too), the React Native DevTools are stable, and build times are faster thanÂ ever.

  • ğŸ¥– Bun is on a roll.. with three releases in the past week. v1.1.31 added support for node:http2 server and gRPC, v1.1.32 added Node's crypto.hash method, and v1.1.33 was a bug-fix release.

  • Express.js 5.0 â€“ Landed a few weeks ago, but now there's an official post explaining the state of theÂ project which has now passed a comprehensive third party securityÂ audit.

  • Medusa 2.0 â€“ A Node.js-powered ecommerceÂ platform.

  • React Compiler Beta, Turborepo 2.2, ESLint v9.13.0, Deno 2.0.2

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â Build a Sonic Infinite Runner Game Using Kaplay â€” A two hour walkthrough of using the Kaplay game library (formerly known as Kaboom.js) to build a complete, if simple, Sonic-branded game. You can also play itÂ here.

JSLegendDev

New Wallaby 2.0 - Works with All Editors - A Massive Step Forward for JavaScript Testing â€” Experience faster JavaScript debugging, real-time insights, & enhanced coverage monitoring with Wallaby 2.0's integratedÂ UI.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Why Iâ€™m Skeptical of Rewriting JavaScript Tools in â€œFasterâ€Â Languages â€” Rewriting common JS infrastructure / build tools in â€˜fasterâ€™ languages like Rust, Zig or Go has become popular in recent years, but is it necessary, asksÂ Nolan?

Nolan Lawson

How to Create a Modern SPA with Django and Vue â€” If you can handle some Python in your life, Django is a powerful backend web framework and itâ€™s quite happy to be paired up with a Vue.js frontend with GraphQL providing theÂ glue.

The Dev Space

Learn How to Build a Full Stack Application Using React Native & Expo â€” Build a cross-platform full-stack app using a single codebase with scalable backend support andÂ authentication.

Clerk sponsor

match-sorter 7.0: Deterministic Best-Match Array Sorting â€” If you have an array of items you want to filter and sort â€˜intelligentlyâ€™ and deterministically, this offers a well-described, predictable algorithm. Play with a live CodeSandboxÂ demo.

Kent C. Dodds

ğŸ¤–Â Transformers.js v3: Run Transformers in the Browser â€” A JS port of Hugging Faceâ€™s transformers Python library that can run natural language, vision, and audio machine learning models right in the browser. v3 adds WebGPU support for boosted performance and now supports Node, Deno and BunÂ too.

Hugging Face

Build Forms from JSON Using Drag & Drop UI â€” SurveyJS Libraries for Surveys & Forms â€” Integrate a JSON form editor with any backend. Enjoy complete control over your data with unlimited users and forms â€” noÂ restrictions.

SurveyJS sponsor

Fetch Mock 12.0: Mock Requests by the fetch API â€” A flexible API for mocking HTTP requests made by fetch or fetch-imitating libraries. Supports browsers, Node, and web/serviceÂ workers.

Rhys Evans

ğŸ“ŠÂ Vizzu 0.14: A Library for Animated Data Visualizations â€” Making visualizations is one thing; animating them is much harder. Vizzu helps you create animated data stories and interactive explorers with a variety of showcase examples forÂ inspiration.

Vizzu Inc.

eslint-plugin-functional: Rules to Promote Functional Programming â€” This isnâ€™t for me, but if you want to encourage (or even force) a lack of mutation and a use of FP techniques in your codebase, this could be for you.

Jonas Kello

Radix Vue: Unstyled, Accessible Components for Vue.js â€” An unofficial Vue port of the popular Radix UI component library. GitHubÂ repo.

#â€‹711 â€” October 31, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Python Jumps to #1 on GitHub Over JavaScript, But... â€” GitHub Universe took place this week, flooding us with data about how folks are using the platform. Of interest to those on social media was that Python has taken JavaScript's #1 language crown, though many argued that TypeScript (now #3) made an impact here. In positive news, JS still ranks first for code pushes alone and there's been a 15% jump in npm package consumption in the pastÂ year.

GitHub

ğŸ‰ In other GitHub news, their Copilot AI coding tool can now use alternative LLMs like Gemini and Claude, and GitHub Spark is a new AI-powered tool for rapidly creating and deploying small apps.

Implementing Clean Architecture in Next.js â€” Learn how to make projects testable and debuggable, independent of UI, framework, database, and external dependencies with the concept of Clean Architecture. Join us live on NovemberÂ 4th.

Sentry sponsor

Should JavaScript Be Split Into Two Languages? â€” Two weeks ago we linked to an interesting slidedeck presented at TC39 where it was proposed to split JavaScript into two languages: a basic core and a fully featured version that needs tooling to compile it down. This covers a bit more of the story and led to a particularly extensive Hacker News discussion too.

Dev Class

ğŸ¤” You could argue TypeScript is already that second language..?

IN BRIEF:

  • âœ‚ï¸ The latest version of VS Code has a new experimental feature for updating imports when you copy and paste between JS/TSÂ files.

  • Lee Robinson and Delba de Oliveira present a quick recap of last week's Next.js Conf 2024 and its mainÂ announcements.

How We Shrunk Our JavaScript Monorepo Git Size by 94% â€” And by â€œweâ€, the author means Microsoft, which had an extremely large 178 gigabyte JavaScript monorepo on its hands â€“ big enough that many employees had problems cloning it at all. Jonathan tells the full storyÂ here.

Jonathan Creamer

How to Roll Your Own Auth in JavaScript and TypeScript â€” A snappy look at how to build a session-based authentication system, something Robin notes â€œdoes not have to beÂ complicatedâ€.

Robin Wieruch

MongoDB Atlas Search Integration with BuildShip â€” MongoDB Atlas Search offers powerful full-text search, vector search, and hybrid searchÂ capabilities.

MongoDB sponsor

Using shadcn/ui with React 19 (and Next.js 15) â€” Fresh documentation from the shadcn/ui project on the specifics of using the popular component library with React 19 generally, though with a slight emphasis on Next.jsÂ 15.

shadcn

Reimplementing JavaScript's == in JavaScript â€” What a trip. Whether or not youâ€™re aware of the â€˜quirksâ€™ of JavaScriptâ€™s == operator, this could boggle yourÂ mind.

Evan Hahn

HTML Form Validation is Heavily Underused â€” An exploration of the â€œpowerful validation mechanismsâ€ of HTML forms, opining that theyâ€™re underused, and proposing why that lack of utilization mayÂ be.

everdimension

Faker.js Team

Fraction.js: Library for Working with Rational Numbers â€” The imprecise representation of floating point numbers can lead to all sorts of problems, so if youâ€™re working with fractions at all, you might want a little more precision, which Fraction.jsÂ offers.

Robert Eisele

item.title: ã€JSConf is backã€‘JSConf å›æ¥äº†
item.description:
ã€

#â€‹712 â€” November 7, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JavaScript's ??= Operator: Default Values Made Simple â€” The ??= nullish coalescing assignment operator snuck into JavaScript a few years ago via ECMAScript 2021 and has been broadly supported almost everywhere for ages. Trevor shows off how it can tighten up your assignmentsÂ here.

Trevor I. Lasn

ğŸ’¡ He also took a similar look at the pipeline operator |>, but this feature is still only in draft as aÂ proposal.

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸Â JSConf is Back; Here's the Details â€” Two months ago, the OpenJS Foundation announced that the popular JSConf brand was joining the foundation and a new North American JSConf event would happen in due course. Now you can mark your calendars for October 14-16, 2025 for an event taking place in the Chesapeake Bay area of Maryland, USA.

OpenJS Foundation

Handsontable: A Powerful Data Grid for InternalÂ Apps â€” Speed up the development of your React app with a feature-rich data grid - sorting, filtering, multiple cell types, built-in formulas, CRUD operations, and an extensive API. Come visit our booth at React Summit US on Nov 19th to see it inÂ action!

Handsontable sponsor

Announcing Rspack 1.1 â€” Rspack is a fast, Rust-powered alternative to Webpack but with the same API. v1.1 boasts being 10% faster than v1.0 and has an improved, though still experimental, incremental build feature. If super fast build times are your bag, this needs to be on yourÂ radar.

The Rspack Team

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ† The OpenJS Foundation has honored six JavaScript developers with awards in categories including Unsung Hero and Pathfinder forÂ Education.

  • The working group behind the JSR package registry has met to outline plans for an open governance model and a roadmap to enhance JS packageÂ management.

  • âš ï¸ Phylum takes a look at yet another (ongoing) typosquatting campaign to try and trick JavaScript developers into installing malicious packages.

  • There's fewer than two weeks left to take the State of React 2024 survey.

  • Storybook offers a sneak peek at their Storybook Test tool for fast UIÂ testing.

RELEASES:

  • VitePress 1.5 â€“ Evan You's Vite and Vue-powered static site generator.

  • create-vue 3.12 â€“ The recommended way to start a Vite-powered Vue project. Now with an experimental OxlintÂ integration.

  • ESLint v9.14.0 â€“ Now supporting import attributes and regexpÂ modifiers.

  • Mermaid 11.4 â€“ The popular diagram / charting tool adds KanbanÂ diagrams.

  • React Navigation 7, Electron 33.1, TinyMCE 7.5.0, Bun v1.1.34

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Wasmer Adds Node.js and Bun Support â€” Wasmer is a Rust-powered WebAssembly runtime and Wasmer 5.0 adds V8 and JavaScriptCore backend support, meaning you can try all sorts of things like, say, running Clang, Python, or even compiled JavaScript apps inside your own JavaScript app..

Syrus Akbary

Why Would Anyone Need Generator Functions? â€” A golden oldie that I enjoyed revisiting because it covers an oft misunderstood and not particularly commonly encountered JavaScriptÂ feature.

James Sinclair

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” Next-level testing in any editor, 15x faster with Interactive Time Travel Debugger, real-time insights & advanced coverage in a newÂ UI.

Wallaby Team sponsor

The Most Effective Ways to Improve Core Web Vitals â€” Everyone wants their site to be as performant as possible, especially when Google factors performance into its rankings, but how? Google shares a variety of practical techniques to improve your INP, LCP, and CLS metricsÂ here.

Google

Why Code Security Matters - Even in Hardened Environments â€” A well diagrammed dive into a technique that allows malicious parties to turn a file write vulnerability in a Node.js app into a remote code execution exploit even when the file system isÂ read-only.

Stefan Schiller (Sonar)

Generating Random Mazes with JavaScript â€” A fun, well-presented walkthrough of a basic maze generationÂ process.

Paul Hebert

Along similarly fun lines is Chris MMO's Generating Lever-DoorÂ Puzzles.

MongoDB Helps Devs Build Better AI Agents with LangChain & HybridÂ Search â€” Itâ€™s easier than ever to build AI agents with LangChain, perform hybrid search and ingest large-scaleÂ documents.

MongoDB sponsor

ğŸš— Hacking Cars in JavaScript â€“ Or â€œRunning Replay Attacks in the Browser with theÂ HackRF.â€ Charlie Gerard

ğŸ“„ How Bun Supports V8 APIs Without Using V8 (Part 2) Ben Grant (Bun)

ğŸ“„ How to Create an Organic Text Distortion Effect with Infinite Scrolling â€“ There's a live demo of the striking, though disorienting, effect. Jorge Toloza

ğŸ“„ Vercel Makes Changes to Next.js to Simplify Self-Hosting Loraine Lawson (The New Stack)

ğŸ“„ The Latest in Angular Change Detection â€“ All You Need to Know Krzysztof Skorupka

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

npmpackage.info: Detailed Package Info on a Single Page â€” Give this online tool the name of an npm package and you get a quick â€˜dashboardâ€™ style view of the projectâ€™s main statistics, covering areas like quality scores, commits, open issues, releases, bundle size, andÂ more.

Shrinath Nayak

ğŸ“Š NPM Chart is another cool new site focused on showing npm package downloadÂ stats.

Prompt, Run, Edit, and Deploy Full-Stack Web Apps with bolt.new â€” StackBlitz recently released an in-browser AI web development agent: bolt.new! Give it a tryÂ today.

StackBlitz sponsor

Docusaurus 3.6: The Docs-Oriented Static Site Generator â€” Metaâ€™s Docusaurus is a popular way to build docs sites (like these). v3.6 is focused on performance, now using tools like Rspack and SWC to make builds superÂ fast.

Meta

Immutable.js 5.0: Immutable Collections for JavaScript â€” Provides numerous persistent immutable data structures including a list, stack, map, ordered map, set, ordered set, andÂ records.

Lee Byron and Contributors

Sonner 1.7: The Toast Notification React Component â€” Thereâ€™s a live demo to try on the homepage, or see the GitHub repo. v1.7 focuses on animation improvements, browser support, and ReactÂ 19.

Emil Kowalski

Quaternion.js: A JavaScript Quaternion library â€” Last week we featured the authorâ€™s Fraction.js library, now we go a step deeper with a way to work with 3D rotations using quarternions.

Robert Eisele

  • BlockNote 0.19 â€“ 'Notion-style' block-basedÂ editor. Now supporting column-based layouts and client-side export to .docx andÂ PDF. There's a demo on the project'sÂ homepage.

  • ğŸ” OpenPGP.js 6.0 â€“ OpenPGP implementation for JavaScript now supporting the new version of the OpenPGP spec, RFC 9580.

  • Fastify 5.1 â€“ The fast, low overhead Node.js webÂ framework.

  • xr 6.4 â€“ Bring VR/AR to React ThreeÂ FiberÂ apps.

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

âš™ï¸ Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try it now.

Meticulous automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others.

Pythagora is an AI dev tool that builds production-ready tools (not demo apps). It writes the code and talks to you in the process.

ğŸ“—Â We're also reading..

We've also had some tabs open that aren't JavaScript specific but you might find interesting nonetheless:

ğŸ«£ Weird Lexical Syntax by Justine Tunney. Justine is building a syntax highlighter and set out to learn 42 programming languages in a single month to help figure out the edge cases. She recounts the surprising things she discovered about the syntax of various languages, includingÂ JavaScript.

ğŸ‘» Before You Buy a Domain, Check if it's Haunted by Bryan Braun. Buying a domain for a side project is always fun, but it's far less fun when the domain was previously used for nefarious purposes and comes withÂ baggage..

ğŸ¤” What Has Case Distinction But is Neither Uppercase or Lowercase? by Raymond Chen. It sounds like a riddle, but there are actually Unicode characters that have case distinction yet are neither uppercase nor lowercaseÂ themselves.
